page.title: 12FARMING, DOWNS EDINGTON (4)
page.content: In the west of the block,200 acres of arable and 150 acres of uncultivated downland slopes are farmed by two brothers.Approximately half of this is MOD land; altogether 800 acres are rented, up to Westbury White Horse.The crop rotation is:- 1st year ,grass ley, harvested for seed;2nd year, seed again or hay;3rd year, grazed or ploughed; 3rd or 4th year, winter wheat sold as seed,following year commercial wheat;5th or 6th year, autumn fallow to clean,then spring barley;the straw ploughed in or burnt with direct re-seed.The Schedule 3 leys are cut for hay,Schedule 1 second and third year leys are cut for silage in May,for hay in July and cut again later for silage.Nitrogen fertilizer is spread by aeroplane once a year on the steep downland grass.
